name: Theresa Dankovich
summary: Chemist and inventor who developed the Drinkable Book, a water purification system for developing countries.
shortDescription: Theresa Dankovich is a chemist and engineer who invented a revolutionary water purification book that can make contaminated water safe to drink. Her innovative paper-based filter technology has the potential to provide clean drinking water to millions of people worldwide who lack access to safe water sources.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in 1985, Theresa showed an early interest in chemistry and solving real-world problems. She pursued her education in chemistry and engineering with a focus on environmental applications.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Theresa earned her PhD in chemistry and developed a revolutionary water purification technology using paper-based filters. Her work combines chemistry, engineering, and environmental science to address global water challenges.
detailed_description.challenges: Faced challenges as a woman in chemistry and engineering, and had to prove that her innovative approach to water purification could work on a large scale.
detailed_description.achievements: Invented a water purification book that can make contaminated water safe to drink, developed paper-based filter technology, and created solutions for global water challenges.
detailed_description.legacy: Theresa's work has the potential to provide clean drinking water to millions of people worldwide and demonstrates how chemistry can solve critical environmental problems.
